title: Sums and Differences
text: Use properties of indefinite integrals of sums and differences so that the problem can be broken down. /int{5x**3}-/int{7*x**2}+/int{3*x}+/int{4}.

title: Sums and Differences
text: Using the properties of indefinite integrals of sums and differeces, $$\int f \,d5x^3-7x^2+3x+4$$ can be rewritten as $$___$$?

title: Constant Multiplies
text: Next, use the properties of constant multiples so you can rewrite the problem.

title: Constant Multiplies
text: Using the constant multiples properties of indefinite integrals, $$\int f \,d5x^3-7x^2+3x+4$$ can be rewritten as $$___$$?

title: Adding Constants
text: Make sure to add "+C" after your intial antiderivative to account for the unknown constant.
